reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 weeks on business. Staff at reception friendly and helpful on arrival. Shown to my room along a dark, poorly lit corridor, complete with resident dog & cat which I nearly tripped over several times! Everything about the place needs a good makeover - well and truly overdue.
reviews.title: Best avoided

reviews.text: The first week I had a room with double bed and bath but no shower. There was an A/C controller on the wall which seemed to be redundant - not least because of the lack of a ventilator outlet anywhere in the room that I could see.
reviews.title: Lots of character for not so much cash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second week the room was bigger, however immovable shutters over the windows meant there was NO natural light at any time in the room. The bed had been pulled to the middle of the floor away from a large damp patch on the wall behind it where the paint & plaster were peeling off the walls onto the floor. In fact it was not even a proper bed, but an uncomfortable camp-style bed.
reviews.title: Get what you pay for

reviews.text: The breakfast provided is very basic - bread rolls, nasty (not fresh) croissants, decaying apples and some yoghurts etc.. If you want a slice of ham it is an extra charge!!!!
reviews.title: Good value and central location
Surprise in Grenoble...
reviews.text: WiFi service constantly going up and down and very slow at the best of times.
